snippet: As the United States threatens sanctions against Russia, influential members of President Putin’s inner circle view isolation from the West as a good thing.
abstract: Influential members of Russian Pres Vladimir Putin's inner circle appear to welcome possibility that United States may impose sanctions on Russia for its occupation of Crimea, Ukraine; some hard-liners, like Stalinist writer Aleksandr A Prokhanov, view isolation from West as good thing, and see confrontation as opportunity to make diplomatic turn toward China.

byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: As the United States threatens sanctions against Russia, influential members of President Putin’s inner circle view isolation from the West as a good thing.

headline.main: Foes of America in Russia Crave Rupture in Ties
headline.print_headline: Russia Hard-Liners Relish Crimea Crisis, Some Eyeing New Cold War
